summary: This document is a chain of forwarded emails between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein and Deutsche Bank. The emails indicate an ongoing AML investigation with a subpoena issued to Deutsche Bank, and coordination with a 'PC team'.

events.title: NYT Article Published on Epstein and Deutsche Bank
events.description: A New York Times article is published regarding Jeffrey Epstein and Deutsche Bank, prompting internal discussion among federal prosecutors.

events.title: Internal US Attorney Coordination on Epstein/Deutsche Bank Case
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discuss the NYT article, an ongoing AML investigation, a subpoena to Deutsche Bank, and coordination with a 'PC team'.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively investigating Deutsche Bank in connection with Jeffrey Epstein as of July 2019.
A subpoena had been issued to Deutsche Bank as part of an Anti-Money Laundering (AML) investigation related to Epstein.
Prosecutors were receiving documents from Deutsche Bank pursuant to the subpoena and review was underway.
The office was coordinating with a 'PC team' (possibly referring to a Prosecution Committee or similar internal group) regarding the case.
The communication shows internal awareness and response to media coverage (NYT article) about the investigation.
